item.title: Loading from mysql
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Yes but it’s pretty stupid integrating a server with remote sql, unless you have a very good reason and a leet caching system in place.

item.title: Loading from mysql
item.dc:creator: @karl1 karl`
item.description:
@karl1 wrote:

[quote=“The cook from runescape, post:2, topic:282819”]I’m glad you think you’re not a noob, I wont have to spoonfeed you. It’s not too difficult if you know how to use MySQL and Java synergetically.

Use JDBC to connect to the MySQL server: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/jdbc/index.html
Learn the actual MySQL from this site: http://www.tizag.com/mysqlTutorial/ It’s for PHP, but the actual queries work exactly the same way.
And I recommend you use pma for database administration, because it can be quite difficult working blind.[/quote]

well i have 2 dedicated servers one with 10gb ram and other with 4 and the one with 4gb ram is hosting a mysql server so could i have it load from there ???[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 09, 2009, 05:32:10 am[/size][hr]B
U
M
P
Z
O
R
E
D

Read full topic

item.title: Loading from mysql
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

I’m glad you think you’re not a noob, I wont have to spoonfeed you. It’s not too difficult if you know how to use MySQL and Java synergetically.

Use JDBC to connect to the MySQL server: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/jdbc/index.html
Learn the actual MySQL from this site: http://www.tizag.com/mysqlTutorial/ It’s for PHP, but the actual queries work exactly the same way.
And I recommend you use pma for database administration, because it can be quite difficult working blind.

Read full topic
